results.title: Sunrise = 日出
results.creator_credit: Yu Benzheng, Xu Jingxin, Yang Gongmin, Shanghai Film Studios, Cao Yu and Wan Fang
results.brief_description:
Chen Bailu is an innocent young lady, compelled by the harsh reality she is forced into, becoming a social butterfly lost among the Shanghai nightclubs. She spends her days circulating amongst the wealthiest tycoons such as Pan Yueting and Zhang George, living a luxurious and voluptuous life style. The sudden arrival of Bailu’s past sweetheart arouses her memories of a simpler life and the longing for a new beginning. She views her world with disgust and contempt, yet she no longer has the power to break away from her extravagant life style.

One day, Bailu rescues a little girl who is ready to be sold into a low-class brothel and names her “little thing”. Due to the sympathetic feelings towards the likeliness of their fates, Bailu claims the little girl as her daughter and uses all her power to protect “little thing”. However, “little thing” does not escape her fate of forced prostitution, even with the help from the good hearted prostitute Cui Xi, the unbearable insult eventually driving “little thing” into suicide.

At the same time, Bailu’s wealthy lover Pan Yueting loses all his money by going against the underworld mafia’s Jin Ba and is on the verge of bankruptcy, leading Bailu into accumulating piles of heavy debts she cannot pay for. Bailu loses all hope for life when she finally learns her debts are been taken care of by Jin Ba, meaning her ownership has been transferred. In her final moments, she looks back to “little thing” and Cui Xi and refuses to exist as a puppet of upper society. She silently swallows some sleeping pills and ends her life.
(Wendy Xu, 2013).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yu Benzheng, Xu Jingxin, Yang Gongmin, Shanghai Film Studios, Cao Yu and Wan Fang

results.title: Sunny munchy crunchy natural food shop
results.creator_credit: Richard Todd, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: If you are a health food buff, this film is for you. Even if you are not, there is still enough in it to tickle your fancy, perhaps strain your credulity. The camera scans shelves stocked with all manner of natural foods to which nary an additive has been added - soya bean and sesame seed products, wild honey, even eggs from hens fed on blackstrap molasses. But the real eye-openers are in what you hear from the store’s proprietor and his customers. (Award: Berlin.)

results.title: Sunflowers
results.creator_credit: Ian McMillan and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: An experimental film which admirably exploits the photogenic qualities of sunflowers. After a poetic opening a rapid montage of images links the flowers with the processes of birth, life and death,

results.title: Sunday lark
results.creator_credit: Sanford Semel and Pathe Contemporary Films
results.brief_description: A lighthearted satire about the computers and gadgets of big business. When a small Chinese-American girl wanders into a modern office building on a Sunday her innocent delight in pressing buttons and using the gadgets creates such chaos that the guard calls for police reinforcements. As they arrive the little girl slips out of the building unnoticed.

results.title: Sunday father
results.creator_credit: Paul Leaf, Sheldon Satin, Films Incorporated and International Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the contemporary situation of a divorced man who takes his daughter on a once-a-week outing on Sunday afternoon. Focuses on the problem of a father trying to be friends with a little girl whom he sometimes feels barely knows him. Featuring Dustin Hoffman and Jane Schisgal with music and vocals by Janis Ian.

results.title: Putting people away
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Psychiatrists have the responsibility for deciding who should and who shouldn’t be locked away, whose behaviour is merely eccentric and who is in fact, mentally ill. This program looks at the effect on people’s civil liberties when they are forcibly detained and questions whether it is necessary for the mentally ill to be hospitalised at all.

results.title: Summing up
results.creator_credit: Bryan Bruty, Mark Hamlyn and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Huw Evan presents this final program in the series, in which experts with varying concerns and criticisms about the treatment of psychiatric disorders confront two psychiatrists. Each topic is illustrated by excerpts from the previous programs. Some of the issues discussed are the use of electro-convulsive therapy, treatment with drugs and enforced hospitalisation.
